metadata.title: CVE-2020-14399 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in LibVNCServer before 0.9.13.Byte-aligned data is accessed through uint32_t pointers inlibvncclient/rfbproto.c. NOTE: there is reportedly "no trust boundarycrossed."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14399` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.3
libvncserver-config - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.3
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.3').
x11vnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
